Left 4 Dead is evil. It's gaming experience is dark, viserally frightening and frequently so intense that it will have you looking over your shoulder just to confirm there isn't a zombie behind you.

That is why it is so incredibly awesome!

So, without any further delay here are my top 10 reasons for why you should definitely buy Left 4 Dead:

1. The survivor characters are well thought out and very relatable.
2. The game has excellent replayability, even in campaign mode.
3. The achievements are carefully crafted, challenging and completely addictive.
4. It does what a zombie game should do: scare the crap out of you.
5. Multi-player is encouraged, rewarding but not always necessary.
6. The varying difficulty levels actually make a difference (just look at my hours on expert)
7. You can play as special infected in multiplayer mode!
8. The level and campaign design is amazing.
9. It's one of the best zombie FPS games ever.
10. It's just so much bloody fun!

My only criticism is that sometimes the available weaponry options feel restricted and limited, but that just adds to the challenge.

You don't just play Left 4 Dead, you experience Left 4 Dead.

So experience it today!

Most multiplayer cooperative games require all players to be more or less in the same level. Left 4 Dead breaks the rule, allowing a less skilled player to nevertheless tag along and be helpful.

This was a moderately entertaining game.  Then twelve months later Left 4 Dead 2 came out which had everything that the original had plus LOADS, LOADS, more.  Thanks for shitting on your most hardcore fans, Valve.  

Why couldn't people who bought Left 4 Dead at least get a discount for Left 4 Dead 2?  Left 4 Dead is basically a beta for Left 4 Dead 2.  Total bullshit.  People who bought this game should also get a handwritten apology from Gabe Newell himself.  £30 wasted on this shit.  I was a huge Valve fan and bought all of their games.  After this Left 4 Dead 2 fiasco, I never bought a Valve game again.  

Anyway, there's absolutely no reason to buy this game any more.  Get the sequel if you want to play a zombie shooting game and don't mind that Valve fucked over their biggest fans.

Pwninator score of the game itself: 6/10

Pwninator score when you factor in what happened subsequently with Left 4 Dead 2: 0/10
I have enjoyed this game. Too bad you can't find multiplayer games because everyone plays the sequel.
pretty good ^_^

Left 4 Dead trás logo de cara uma história simples de 4 pessoas que sobreviveram a uma epidemia, mas sem nenhuma evolução de enredo o seu desenrolar. Tem forte apelo ao modo cooperativo, sendo que mesmo ao se jogar sozinho, você terá a companhia de 3 bots que, por sinal, tem razoável inteligência artificial.

O objetivo é simplesmente sobreviver às hordas de infectados que surgem até que os sobreviventes achem uma forma de pedir socorro. Para isso é necessário que haja trabalho em equipe, cautela e economia de recursos. No geral é um ótimo Survival Horror, com fases muito bem feitas, porém a presença de um enredo seria de grande valia para tornar este belo jogo ainda melhor. MUITO BOM (8/10).

While overshadowed by its definitely superior successor, L4D is still a great and addictive zombie themed coop game.
In some aspects it even remains better than the sequel, like its darker tone or better survival mode.
Overall it feels lacking compared to L4D2 (less weapons and no melee ones, less special infected, less game modes), but on its own it still is a fun and solid coop game!

Can I get better recommendation to any game that I've played it 3764 times, spend in game more than 2600 hpurs in nearly three years?
And this is only some basic facts that  cannot adequate describe my in-game feelings. Many times I've asked myself whati in this game is so adoictivelly immersive, that I've to spent so much time, allthough I posses more than 100 verg good games'
Finally I can say that L4D is grounded on the deeply humanistic orientated and composed game I've ever personally meet. Even if you play it single, there are so good (and funny) dialogues that feel some kind of deeply socialised partnership. Actually, after few trials you somehow know that you are usual member of the "apocalypticcy survibal crew" . 
Additionally, every NPC has own style, personality, and recognizable value system, belief and precipously portretet character. NPC-s are never boring, you'll not noticed any kind of fepetitioning sequence, even if I recognized appropriate sentence, because it is usually happened in a kind of new situation.
Also, this game is somehow react on your way of playing, so sonmetimes you'll find a lot of unexpectzed situation - as you usuali have on higher level. In my opinion this is very good, because on that way game cannot become a kind of boring content.
I warmly  recommend L4D to any gamer (not only to FPS lover, 'cause I'm personally NOT FPS lover...)), In my opinion, L4D1 is bacsed on deeply humanisticly oriented game, warm stoy of usual humans, who give us a hope, even that things go worse. 

Aččthough it seems to be uncorrest - but legitimate - previously written L4D1 recomendation CANNOT be used as a concept of L4D2 RECOMENDATION, but rather as very opposite. Just say onestly: L4D2  is deeply missing tragic atempt, basic on idea that something what is actuaslly perfect, can be renewed to be "more" perfect?

Steam de satın aldığım ilk oyunumdu bu yüzden bu oyunun yeri bende bi ayrıdır , ne yazık ki oyunu nosteam olarak 2 bin saatin üzerinde oynadıktan sonra ancak steamden alabilmiştim o zaman 20 $ gibi bir fiyat etiketine sahipti ,  Tekrar eden bir oynanışa sahip olsa da çoğu oyunucun kalbine yerleşen bir oyun serisidir kendileri , şuan indirimle 3 tl gibi bir fiyata alabildiğiniz Klasik modlarda 4 kişi oynayabildiğiniz ( co-op) Topluluk sunucularında 32 oyuncuya kadar oynayabilirsiniz popülerliğini yitirsede hala hatrı sayılır bir kitle tarafından oynanmakta yaklaşık ( 500 -1k ) online sayısına sahip , oyun tamamiyle türkçe bu yüzden dialoglarda hiçbir şeyi kaçırmayacaksınız karakterlerin aralarında konuşmaları sizi motive edebilir ayrıyeten oyun için bir türkçe rehberine sahibim. bu rehbere ulaşmak için https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=244237513 icona tıklamanız yeterlidir   daha fazla detay yazmaktadır. I still remember when this was released back in 2008, I didn't leave my Xbox 360 alone for almost a year. I played this game every night that I could and there's a reason for that, it's a DAMN good game and the co-op/PvP aspects of the different gamemodes are perfect. There's been zombie games, but none were ever like Left 4 Dead. It was an entirely new experience that glued me to my controller once I started playing. I even met one of my best friends in this game. Basically, if you don't play this game, then f*ck you. Buy it, ask your God for forgiveness, then thank me later.

My Rating: 8.5/10

L4D was (and still is), an instant classic sadly overshadowed by the sudden and unfair release of L4D2 not more then a year later, which had effectively split the community to such a degree that L4D has in the end never truly recovered. L4D had brought something new and unique to the table, and had efficiently created the zombie genre craze that was soon to follow. L4D boasts finely detailed and realistic graphics (still to this day!), quality atmosphere, memorable characters and stunning visual settings and: a "revolutionary" zombie-director which creates: "a dynamic system for game dramatics, pacing, and difficulty". L4D - being called a beta version of L4D2, was in the grand scheme never meant to last... and unfortunately so... but as a good friend of mine once said: "L4D is for cool people!". I agree with that statement. Left For Dead is a true cooperative shooter, and should be in every PC gamers list of owned titles.
While rendered obsolete with the updates of L4D2, L4D is still an amazing game on it's own terms; there's something about it's purity that helps it to one-up its sibling, in a way.

Left 4 Dead is about the seemingly hot new fad in storytelling: the dreaded zombie apocalypse has finally come to pass, turning the vast majority of the population into a mindless, ravenous undead hordes. A handful of humans remain immune to the zombie virus, and you play as a small group of them. There's Zoey, a young woman; Bill, the grizzled veteran; Louis, the middle-class office worker; and Francis, the biker. Armed with real and makeshift weapons, these survivors must battle their way to salvation. It's a simple plot that anyone can recognize, and Valve pulls it off with its trademark incredible attention to detail.
